Flow Thresholds for Number of Weeks Inundated

Estimated relationship between duration of inundation and monthly mean flow

weeks_inundated

Format

dataframe with rows and 3 variables

watershed

name of CVPIA watershed

weeks_inundated

integer value between 0 and 4 to represent weeks of floodplain inundation

flow_threshold

flow threshold in cubic feet per second associated with number of weeks inundated

Source

Sadie Gill sgill@flowwest.com

Details

Visual inspection of measured flow and professional judgement were used to define relationships between number of days inundated and the mean monthly flow.

Relationship Modeled:

  • Sacramento River

  • Big Chico Creek

  • Butte Creek

  • Cottonwood Creek

  • Deer Creek

  • Elder Creek

  • Sutter Bypass

  • Bear River

  • Feather River

  • Yuba River

  • Yolo Bypass

  • American River

  • Calaveras River

  • Merced River

  • Stanislaus River

  • Tuolumne River

  • San Joaquin River

All other watersheds are assumed to have a two week inundation.

Examples

weeks_inundated
#>            watershed weeks_inundated flow_threshold
#> 1         Yuba River               0              0
#> 2         Yuba River               1             NA
#> 3         Yuba River               2             NA
#> 4         Yuba River               3             NA
#> 5         Yuba River               4            800
#> 6    Big Chico Creek               0              0
